title: Historical Stock Splits and Corporate Actions of Mercury General Corp

content.text: Mercury General Corp is founded and becomes a publicly traded company.
A 2-for-1 stock split is announced, effectively doubling the number of outstanding shares.
Mercury General Corp expands its operations and acquires several smaller insurance companies.
Another 2-for-1 stock split is announced, increasing the number of outstanding shares.
Mercury General Corp announces a dividend increase, rewarding shareholders with higher payouts.
As the global financial crisis erupts, Mercury General Corp experiences a decline in stock value.
Mercury General Corp raises its dividend once again, demonstrating stability and strong financial performance.
A 3-for-2 stock split is announced, adjusting the number of outstanding shares to meet market demand.
